items.content:
Cloud Reliability Engineer

  • Canonical
  • London, United Kingdom

Canonical delivers and manages OpenStack and Kubernetes for leading companies around the world. Our Cloud Developers are responsible for operating cloud services for both Canonical and our customers. They are software engineers with a particular focus on operations, automation, rapid analysis and problem resolution. We pride ourselves on having world-leading operations agility and quality, and we distill that knowledge into our open source operations toolset.

This role is ideal for skilled software engineers with a passion for distributed systems and an interest in the entire Linux stack - from kernel to networking to virtualization and containers. It is a demanding role that requires rigor in both code and customer interactions.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES:

  • Understand and operate cloud and container technology from kernel to dashboard - OpenStack and Kubernetes
  • Automate operations for reuse across the worlds largest companies, taking into consideration the complexities of distributed systems
  • Demonstrate expertise in both the technology and industry operations standards
  • Implement new features and improve the resilience and scalability of the existing cloud and container portfolio at Canonical
  • Automate testing and benchmarking capabilities for low-level and high-level software Operate production OpenStack clouds for Canonical and its clients
  • Operate production Kubernetes clusters for Canonical and its clients
  • Develop skills in troubleshooting, capacity planning, and performance analysis
  • Collaborate on documentation, playbooks, policies and procedures
  • Provide assistance and guidance to Canonical’s Support and Operations teams
  • Collaborate with globally distributed engineering, operations, and support peers
  • Ensure service level agreements are met
  • Carry final responsibility for time-critical escalations

REQUIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:

  • Engineering degree, preferably in computer science or software engineering
  • Python software development experience, with large projects
  • Extensive knowledge of cloud computing concepts and technologies
  • Practical knowledge of Linux networking, routing, and firewalls
  • Hands-on experience administering Linux servers for personal use
  • Able to communicate clearly and effectively in English over email, IRC, and in person
  • Self-driven, able to troubleshoot from kernel to web, and willing ask others when appropriate
  • Highly motivated, productive, organized and capable of working from home full time
  • Familiar with Ubuntu or Debian

Desired Skills

  • DevOps
  • Linux

Contact Info

  • Company Website: https://www.canonical.com/

items.content:
Location: Remote work from anywhere in the US.
Shift: 5pm - 1:30 am

Duration: 12 months+

Title: L1 Cyber Security Engineer

Areas of Improvement from current consultant:

  • Must have excellent communication skills
  • Must have experience troubleshooting large complex and multi-context firewall environments

Experience

  • Over five years' experience as a cyber security engineer and providing level 2 and level 3 support.
  • Experience providing more advanced adds/moves/changes to the firewall/security/network infrastructure.
  • Execute Network Firewall deploy - weekly changes
  • Support external team's changes, ensuring Network Security infrastructure is not impacted

  • Provide problem, root-cause and prevention plan input as required

  • Experience with IDS/IPS
  • Cyber Security Defense Center (CRDC) support:
  • Monitor high-risk security issues
  • Run basic reports in Splunk and provide output to the KP day shift staff

Experience with the following infrastructure products:

  • Palo Altos, Models are; 5060's 7050's, 3020's, 3050's
  • M-100 Log collectors
  • M-100 Panoramas
  • Cisco 5585x RAS and IPSEC B2B Firewalls
  • 5520's RAS/PCI
  • FWSMs and ASA's
  • Juniper/ Pulse Secure, MAG 6611m, SM_360 Modules, CM-060 modules, SM-160 module

Regards,
Megha Ananthakrishna

Technical Resource Manager | MatchPoint Solutions | Office | Email

items.title: IS Manager, Menards.com Systems - Menard, Inc - Eau Claire, WI
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=18, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
IS Manager, Menards.com Systems
Menard, Inc -Eau Claire, WI 54703

Menards is looking for a manager in our IS department to manage the teams that are responsible for developing the features, functionality, and operations for all aspects of the Menards.com website. The ideal candidate for this position is a hands-on manager and mentor that excels at developing new talent, team building, managing projects, creating specifications, collaborating with business and technical teams, and thinking outside the box to propose new ideas and solutions. This role requires the person to consider security, redundancy, and high availability in the systems their team designs.

At Menards you will have the opportunity to manage in a collaborative, fast-paced environment where quality and guest satisfaction is paramount. This position will have the opportunity to work across teams, establish and drive IS team standards, and develop the foundational frameworks that are utilized across Menards IS.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Lead a staff of IT professionals and provide coaching and mentoring
  • Provide strategic and technical guidance to the Developer and Software Engineer team to lead to their deliverables
  • Oversee the overall design and architecture of the solutions being implemented within the team
  • Ensure that department shifts are adequately staffed, properly trained and that current standards and procedures are in place to guide staff
  • Determine staffing needs; delegate work assignments to ensure support, maintenance and systems development is implemented according to specifications and standards
  • Work on continuous process improvement and progression of the department standards and procedures with continual education and training of the department staff
  • Ensure that sound testing procedures are in place and utilized for any production release of equipment or application
  • Responsible for the project planning, documenting and implementation within the department
  • Responsible for salary administration and performance monitoring of direct reports in coordination with the Director and CIO
  • Enforce the corporate and IS Security Guidelines and provide feedback for improvements to this policy
  • Ensure that team members are cross-trained in all application areas for which the team is responsible
  • Properly evaluate appropriate vendor proposals and negotiate best value in coordination with the Director and CIO
  • Build relationships with major consultants and vendors in order to facilitate key company initiatives
  • Communicate in a timely manner with customers, supervisors, staff and peers; produce all management reports accurately on time
  • Maintain current knowledge of new developments in the technology marketplace and communicate this knowledge appropriately; investigate options and help plan strategies to keep the company in the mainstream of information technology
  • Responsible for strategic guidance, professional development and performance of direct reports in coordination with the Director and CIO
  • Ensure sufficient systems capacity and processing capability for organizational needs

Standards and Procedures:

  • Proactively recommend processes, standards and procedures to prevent problems
  • Identify problem trends early; develop and execute action plans to determine problems and implement; report any type of problems or potential problems to the appropriate management in a timely manner

Project Management:

  • Plan and present strategy to meet the current and future needs of respective business areas and review with business user
  • Participate in projects and corporate initiatives as directed by Supervisor
  • Ensure that project is correctly planned according to established methodologies and standards
  • Ensure that project work plan is followed and is updated to ensure customer requirements are met in a timely manner and within allocated budget
  • Make certain that the project includes appropriate representation from users as well as IS departments
  • Maintain contact and communication with users, appropriate IS team members, directors and upper-level management
  • Develop, maintain and publish project books and plans in accordance with the published IS standards

Project Standards and Procedures:

  • Enforce all company and departmental standards and procedures to develop and support projects
  • Provide input to IS Standards and Procedures if existing standards require modifications or changes for improvement
  • Coach and teach staff in proper use, continuous improvement and ongoing implementation of IS Standards and Procedures
  • Responsible for all quality assurance of projects and project team members' assignments

Security and Confidentiality:

  • Responsible for overall data security, confidentiality and prevention of unauthorized attempts to obtain corporate information, corporate assets or access to restricted areas; report all incidents to management
  • Suggest and recommend ideas for systems and data security
  • Create and require non-disclosure agreements when applicable

Development & Support:

  • Maintain an in-depth knowledge of the user’s operations and key business rules to facilitate communication regarding requirements
  • Meet with business users to evaluate and assess customer satisfaction
  • Ensure Service Level Agreements are developed and met
  • Analyze user enhancements and maintenance requests, determine priorities and possible solutions and assign resources to complete necessary changes
  • Actively participate in developing program specifications, writing code, testing and implementing program changes and program development
  • Ensure Team Leaders and other IS Professionals develop test plans and thoroughly test and debug all programs prior to implementation
  • Provide advanced-level technical support to Menards' IS staff
  • Bachelor Degree in a Computer Science, Software Development, Software Engineering or related field
  • 5+ years of professional full Software Development Life Cycle experience
  • 5+ years of professional experience in Java-based development including Spring, Hibernate, SOPA APIs, and RESTful APIs.
  • Excellent Skills In:
    • Object-oriented analysis and design skills, preferably in Java
    • Supervisory, management, and performance management skills; interpersonal skills; customer service skills; organizational skills; project management skills and knowledge of project management tools; and verbal and written communication skills
    • Negotiating with vendors to provide service to the corporation
  • Solid knowledge of Oracle, SQL, or object relational database design concepts and practices
  • Strong analytical, consultative, and communication skills; as well as the ability to make good judgment and work with both technical and business personnel
  • Required to carry cell phone at all times
  • Must work within designated normal office hours - Monday-Friday, 40 hours/week - at the Corporate Office in Eau Claire, WI (remote work is not offered); while also providing on call support, including weekends and holidays
  • Candidates must be eligible to work in the United States, presently and in the future, without sponsorship

To Apply:

1. Submit an online application:

www.menards.com/careers

2. Email resume & unofficial transcripts to:

Amy Albers, Corporate Human Resources Coordinator

aalbers@menard-inc.com

Please complete step 1 & 2 to complete the application process

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=14, other=2, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
ABOUT US

At Close.io we’re building the sales communication platform of the future. We’ve built a next-generation CRM that eliminates manual data entry and helps sales teams close more deals. We are hiring engineers to join our DevOps team to help take our platform to the next level by adding new features, providing better performance, and even higher reliability. We are a ~30 person remote team that is profitable and building a product our customers love.

Our backend tech stack currently consists of Python Flask/Gunicorn web apps with our TaskTiger scheduler handling many of the backend asynchronous processing tasks. Our data stores include MongoDB, Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL, MySQL, and Redis. Our infrastructure runs on AWS using a combination of managed services like RDS and ElastiCache as well as EC2 instances managed by Puppet. These EC2 instances run everything from our databases to our Kubernetes clusters.

ABOUT YOU

We're looking for a full-time DevOps Engineer to join our core team who has significant experience building, managing, and monitoring infrastructure and backend services at scale.

Come help us with projects like...

  • Building out our Kubernetes infrastructure to include additional services, increased redundancy/scalability, and harnessing new k8s features
  • Scale our Elasticsearch and MongoDB clusters to support our data growth
  • Tune our MySQL and PostgreSQL databases
  • Improve our public Close.io API performance and resiliency
  • Tighten security across our infrastructure
  • Implement autoscaling techniques that balance performance, workload demands and costs
  • Improve our CI/CD process making builds/deployments faster and safer
  • Further develop our Prometheus/Grafana monitoring infrastructure
  • Enhance our Elasticsearch/Logstash/Kibana (ELK) logging stack

You should...

  • Have real world experience building scalable systems, working with large data sets, and troubleshooting various back-end challenges under pressure
  • Have significant experience with *nix, Python, bash, and Puppet or similar backend systems and frameworks
  • Experience working with large databases running on MySQL, PostgreSQL, and/or Mongo
  • Have experience configuring monitoring, logging, and other tools to provide visibility and actionable alerts
  • Enjoy automating processes using Python, bash, Puppet, or other scripting languages
  • Have experience with Docker containers and microservices
  • Understand the full web stack, networking, and low level Unix computing
  • Always be thinking of ways to improve reliability, performance, and scalability of the infrastructure
  • Be self-motivated and comfortable with responsibility

Why work with us?

  • Our story and team retreat video!
  • Stellar team reviews on Glassdoor
  • Work remotely and create your own schedule (we believe in trust and autonomy)
  • Enjoy face-to-face time with the whole team on all-expense paid retreats 2x year.
  • Experience building a truly successful SaaS company with a dedicated, small team where you can have a huge impact
  • Above market salary
  • Excellent medical & dental coverage, including 99% paid premiums and HSA option (*US residents*)
  • Matching 401k (*US residents*)

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=41, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=15, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=4, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=26}
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: DevOps
Industry: Big Data, Cloud Services, CMS
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

.netnode.jsjavascriptreact-nativedevops

Job description

The Work

The Microsoft DevOps Engineer position entails system engineering tasks related to the Microsoft stack, Azure infrastructure and application deployment.  The DevOps Engineer is also responsible for strategic infrastructure choices, standard operating procedures and appropriate monitoring and management of Mercury’s cloud infrastructure and our clients' deployed production applications.

The DevOps Engineer will be engaged in a range of web and native application development including:

  • Azure infrastructure solution engineering for JavaScript and NoSQL-focused web and native solutions
  • Visual Studio Team Services management, pipeline development and continuous deployment
  • Ongoing Application Insights, App Center and application metrics monitoring and resolution
  • Implement infrastructure for large-scale .NET web applications
  • Participate in full-stack JavaScript application development including React, React Native and Node.JS
  • Deploy iOS and Android native applications

Skills & Requirements

The position requires a strong background in systems, cloud infrastructure and experience with the Microsoft cloud ecosystem.  Mercury's technical staff possess strong skills in the technologies of their trade and, just as importantly, exhibit maturity in design patterns, architectural best practices and development frameworks.  Interpersonal communication, time management and technical excellence are expected of the DevOps Engineer.

Some Specifics

At Mercury you will:

  • Work with a full team following GitFlow with Visual Studio Team Services-based continuous deployment pipelines
  • Deploy, maintain and monitor Microsoft cloud infrastructure (Azure PaaS, IaaS, AAD and Office 365)
  • Stand up and administer databases (VM-installed SQL Server, PaaS Azure SQL and Azure Cosmos)
  • Set up and operate automated test infrastructure and runners including technology such as Selenium, Jest and Appium
  • Implement Microsoft Modern Identity solutions for cloud applications
  • Write ample amounts of PowerShell

Proficiency and comfort on Agile teams (specifically, Scrum with 2 week sprints) will be a major plus for this position.

What Kind of Projects Will You Work On?

  • Web, native mobile and collaboration applications for the Southeast's fastest growing commercial real estate firms
  • React applications for publicly-traded consumer products company
  • Single page applications for dominant regional logistics firm
  • iOS and Android applications for Fortune 50 consumer products field workforce

How to Know If You're A Fit

If any of the following excites you, we definitely want to talk to you!

  • Continuous Delivery
  • DevOps at Microsoft
  • Launch Darkly
  • Jez Humble
  • To Be Continuous Podcast

This Is A Remote-Friendly Position

Mercury is a distributed workforce with developers and designers located throughout the United States.  We are open to applicants located anywhere in the continental United States (we fine all team members being within 3 time zones of each other best for collaboration) and also Tampa-based developers.

About Mercury

We are a Florida-based group of talented designers and developers devoid of heavy corporate structures, approval processes and tight boundaries.  Noted by our clients as giving that little extra that truly sets us apart, we seek to build sustained, successful relationships, ship customized solutions and deliver strategic counsel and zealous service.  mercurynewmedia.com 

About H1B Visas and Recruiters

At this time we are not considering the sponsorship of H1B candidates.  Also, no recruiters.  Definitely; please no recruiters.  None.  No matter how good you think your candidate is.

Apply now

About Mercury New Media

We are a closely-held web and mobile application development firm and we are looking for a driven senior-level .NET developer.  Are you experienced and current in your .NET development skills and dig REST-based WebAPI services decoupled from the front end?  Looking for a no-politics zone to do your best work? Mercury is the place for you!

We are a Westshore-based group of talented designers and developers devoid of heavy corporate structures, approval processes and tight boundaries.  We're situated just right for Tampa AND Pinellas residents and ya, we work from home sometimes, too.

Benefits

  • Health Coverage
  • Supplemental Coverage
  • Paid Vacation
  • Paid Holidays
  • Sick and Person Time Off
  • Training & Education

At BuzzSumo, we have a simple goal: to provide social insights on what content is resonating with their audience. We run extensive crawlers that crawl the entire web 24/7, storing terabytes of data that need to be indexed, processed and queried.Our SaaS product is used by over 3400 customers, ranging from publishers like BuzzFeed to Fortune 500 brands like Disney. We are looking for a devops engineer with experience in Elasticsearch, and distributed systems. We are a remote team, mostly based in the UK and US.What you'll be doing:- Monitor our Elasticsearch clusters, Postgres databases, and other systems in production.- Perform upgrades on existing Elasticsearch infrastructure - Refactor existing Elasticsearch queries (we use Ruby) as we upgrade infrastructure.- Recommend and implement ways to improve uptime, and performance- Monthly tasks like provisioning new servers, adding new nodes and databases.Required Skills:- Elasticsearch- Experience distributed systemsNice to Have:- Sidekiq- Ruby/Ruby on Rails- Postgres

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: DevOps, System Administrator
Industry: Job Placement
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: VC Funded

Technologies

amazon-web-servicesjenkinsterraformchefpuppetsysadmin

Job description

Infrastructure/DevOps Engineer - remote Europe or London    £30-65k + options

About us:

Adzuna is a job search engine that lists every job, everywhere. From launch in the UK in 2011, we now have more than 10 million visitors a month and are busy conquering the world from our office in West London. Right now, we're seeking an experienced Infrastructure/DevOps Engineer to join our world class tech team in helping millions of people find better, more fulfilling jobs.

The role:

Our engineering and product teams are pivotal to Adzuna's future. It's an exciting time as we scale our existing product offering and also innovate with new tools and user experiences that 'surprise and delight' our audience, like ValueMyCV, which we're really proud of. Our infrastructure supports 16 internationalised Adzuna websites, as well as the 'Find a Job' portal that we run on behalf of the UK Government. Our growing global footprint and site visitor numbers mean that the dev/ops environment needs to grow too, ensuring a reliable, efficient and scalable infrastructure that supports all our client and team needs.

Based in our great Fulham office, (or remotely) you will work with a smart team of dev/ops, back end, data science/machine learning and product specialists, collaborating to plan, design, implement and review the infrastructure, software and tools that power the Adzuna job finding experience. There will be the ongoing need to monitor, maintain, test and debug our infrastructure, whilst responding to the specific needs of Adzuna clients and fellow developers, who all buy into a shared DevOps philosophy.

You’ll be safeguarding secure development and production environments and practices, as well as implementing and mentoring others on industry best practice, and trying out and implementing new, technologies and approaches. Naturally, you’re fastidious when it comes to documenting components and operations, whilst ensuring we meet our SLAs with clients, which may include some out of hours emergency support.

Our opportunity offers the chance to build something to be proud of, whilst becoming a part of one of the fastest growing businesses in Europe. It's a fun and fast moving environment. Join us!

About you:

We don't like to put people in boxes, but you're likely to be able to demonstrate much of the below:

  • Able to demonstrate that you can plan, design, implement and review infrastructure requirements
  • Proven track record in deploying solutions for high volume websites
  • Determined to deliver processes that monitor, maintain, test and debug our infrastructure
  • Proficiency in installing, configuring, running and patching Linux
  • Can act as an advisor to non-technical stakeholders, whilst supporting the needs of engineering teams
  • Strength in documentation and operational administration
  • Understands the need for an 'always on' approach to uptime
  • A tenacious ability to debug and fix performance and reliability problems rapidly
  • Comfortable working with a distributed team

Technical competency and tools

  • Proficiency in one or more of Chef, Puppet, Ansible
  • Proficiency in one or more of Perl, Ruby, Python, C, or Go
  • Designing and maintaining infrastructure in AWS Using Terraform, Packer, Jenkins, Chef
  • Using Nginx, Memcached, message queue systems
  • Identifying and fixing MySQL
  • Read/write bottlenecks Identifying and fixing Solr bottlenecks

What we offer:

  • £30k-£45k if remote
  • £45-£65k if based in our London offices
  • Stock options
  • 25 days holiday
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Childcare vouchers
  • A positive attitude towards flexible working and parental leave 
  • A Values based culture
  • Company contributory pension scheme
  • Huge learning opportunity from smart, experienced colleagues
  • Table tennis table and a program of team social events
  • Bright, airy office with roof terrace, in the heart of bustling Fulham Broadway
Apply now
Ask a question

About Adzuna

More about Adzuna:

Adzuna  is a search engine for job ads used by over 10 million visitors per month that aims to list every job, everywhere.  We search thousands of websites so our users don't have to, bringing together millions of ads in one place. By providing smarter search options and powerful data about the job market, we give jobseekers the information they need to take control of their careers.

Adzuna.co.uk  was founded in 2011 by Andrew Hunter and Doug Monro, formerly of eBay, Gumtree, Qype and Zoopla and is backed by leading Venture Capital firms Passion Capital, LocalGlobe, Index Ventures and Smedvig Capital.

We also supply real-time data to the Number 10 Dashboard and Office for National Statistics labour market indices. In 2018, Adzuna won the contract to run FindAJob, one of the British government’s most used online services.

Adzuna’s mission is to be the best place to start looking for a job.  We love using the awesome power of technology to help match people to better, more fulfilling jobs and keep Britain working.

Benefits

  • 25 days holiday
  • Stock options
  • Company pension scheme
  • Kitchen - fruit and snacks
  • Great location and offices in Fulham
  • Childcare vouchers
  • Family friendly working options
  • Table tennis table
  • Cycle to work scheme
  • Adzuna Academy training programme

items.title: Senior System Administrator at Kodify
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=14, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=13, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
About this job Job type: Full-time Experience level: Senior Role: System Administrator Industry: Entertainment, Media, Online Media Company size: 11-50 people Company type: Private Technologies dockerkubernetesamazon-web-servicessysadmin Job description

The team at Kodify is looking for a System Administrator to join our team. This position is open to remote candidates as well as those based in Barcelona (a plus!). You will form part of a SysAdmin team, joining them (one remote, one based in Barcelona) on a quest to make our servers and systems the most functional, safest and robust to date. You will work alongside two cross-functional teams, dedicated to different Kodify products. They work with different tech stacks that bring an interesting set of technical challenges to overcome. With our SysAdmin team on board, we’re looking to bring a more unified systems architecture across our products.

Key responsibilities:

  • Maintain and support the infrastructure and system operations for stability and security
  • Configure and install the servers and continuously work on improving system’s performance
  • Configuration, deployment, administration, monitoring and analysis of application services and systems
  • Investigate, research and update our systems to the latest architecture solutions
  • Improve functionality of the system platform and tools
  • Maintain the on-call system rotation. Check logs for errors with systems and servers; create alerts for developers

Must have:

  • 3-4 years of experience in Linux- based web server and system administration
  • Operational AWS experience: EC2, Autoscaling, CloudFormation
  • Experience with monitoring and alerting tools: (Pagerduty, NewRelic, Loggly, Wormly, Graphite)
  • Knowledge of orchestration tools
  • Docker
  • Container orchestration tools (kubernetes, swarm, mesos)
  • Experience with Testing tools (Jenkins, Travis, Codeship...)
  • ElasticSearch, MongoDB
  • MySQL, Aurora
  • Redis
  • Memcache
  • Confident on the command line - Python, Bash
  • Fluent English level.

Bonus knowledge points:

  • Knowledge and experience in Git and Docker - major plus!
  • Experience with Lambda functions and CodeDeploy
  • ZeroMQ 
  • PHP & Javascript
  • NodeJS
  • Microservices Architecture
  • CDNs/cache (cloudflare, cloudfront...)
  • Experience managing high traffic websites.
  • Experience working in an Agile/Scrum development process

About you:

  • You’re a real team player. You love to help and find solutions together.
  • Your sense of humor will bring a new dynamic to the team - you love to have fun while you work!
  • You can think on your feet and adapt well to fast-changing environments and priorities.
  • You love analysing data. You’re a complexity thinker and a real problem solver.
  • You’re flexible and available when needed. You understand emergency calls can be part of the job and are aware of the challenges supporting a 24/7 environment.
  • You stay updated on industry developments and strive to improve our platform with innovative solutions.
Apply now About Kodify

Kodify is based on years of success, building and managing high-traffic websites. We have grown our websites to 7M visitors per day which comes with a challenging set of technical problems to overcome. Our success is down to Kodify’s teamwork, where each one of us plays a key role in getting us one step closer to our goals. All of this doesn’t happen without a healthy portion of fun & perks! From company BBQs on our fantastic terrace to yearly company off-sites, we make sure to live by our motto “Work Hard, Play Harder” and balance it all out! It’s our goal to create one of the best working environments possible which allow everyone to grow and achieve their maximum potential with their individual skill sets.

What’s on offer:

  • Permanent employment contract.
  • Core hours with flexitime: work when you’re at your most creative!
  • €2000 referral bonus.
  • Training and development budget and free days to attend training/conferences/etc.
  • Latest tech equipment: choose whatever boosts your productivity!
  • Agile environment
  • 10% time for personal projects
  • Free afternoons on Fridays
  • Company Amazon book account
  • Half Day off on your Birthday
  • Personalised cake for your work anniversary.
  • Awesome offices and locations: Barcelona, Altea, LA, and Montreal!
  • Kodify on-site and off-sites, events and team activities!
  • Quarterly on-site meetings where we work and play harder!
  • Unique Kodify culture!

Anything off the list? Tell us and we might add it! 

Benefits
  • Competitive salary
  • 10% time for personal projects
  • Private health insurance
  • Core hours with Flexitime
  • Brand new equipment on joining
  • Learning and development budget
  • Free lunches
  • Yearly 3 day company off-sites
  • Free snacks, drinks and lots of team activities!
  • Amazing offices in: Barcelona, LA, Altea and Montreal!

items.title: DevOps Engineer (Remote)
items.content:
DevOps Engineer (Remote) - Jobmote

DevOps Engineer (Remote)

CivicActions

CivicActions is a dedicated, fun-loving team, looking for some talented folks to help us bring revolutionary digital services to government agencies and the people they serve.

Responsibilities & Qualifications

For this position, we need people with experience in:

  • Continuous integration & continuous deployment
  • Infrastructure-as-code based configuration management
  • Amazon Web Services environment
  • Agile Development environments
  • Creating and maintaining documentation
  • Understanding of systems and network architecture
  • Working with cross-functional teams (users, developers, product managers)
  • Breaking down complex problems into understandable and iterative solutionsTechnologies Used

We use the following stack for this project:- Free/Libre and open source software- GNU/Linux- Ansible- AWS CloudFormation- Docker- Kubernetes- Jenkins- ElasticSearchLocation

This position is remote, provided the candidate can do some onsite travel to the project location in Sacramento, CA.

Salary Range

$89,000 - $127,000 Annually
Salary commensurate with qualifications and experience.

Benefits

We excel in our benefits offering and believe that people who are well taken care of can be more balanced, healthy and happy. We offer 100% company-paid medical insurance, disability insurance, and life insurance. We have a generous 401(k) program. We have an open vacation policy -- employees are encouraged to take time off as needed to feel balanced, productive and healthy. We have paid maternity and paternity leave. We have an annual all-hands retreat to connect with each other in person. We also emphasize professional development and offer an annual stipend.

Community participation is important to us and we ask that you spend 5% of your working time giving back to a community that you care about. We attempt to keep our work products 'open by default'. This means that it is our intention that your work contributions during your time at CivicActions will be published under public license, enabling you to bring your passion fully into your activities without the fear that your expressions will be locked away or prevented from having a positive impact in the world.

About CivicActions

CivicActions is a digital services firm building elegant and accessible government services for everyone.

We are passionate civic designers and developers specializing in free and open source agile software development, user-centered design, security/compliance and open data.

We lead the efforts behind Agile Government Leadership (AGL) and Project DKAN. AGL brings together public sector IT leaders to help understand and implement Agile project management practices within government. Project DKAN is the global open source project that manages development and direction for the DKAN open data platform.

In 2017, CivicActions was named to Government Technologys esteemed GovTech 100 list.

Apply

We find strength and inspiration in the things that make each of us unique. In striving for a more diverse team, we strongly encourage women, people of color, and physically-challenged people to apply.

items.content:
Operations Admin Team Member

Posted Jun 22

Relationship Development
Headquarters: Bucks County, PA
http://RelationshipDevelopment.org
View all Relationship Development jobs →

Doyou LOVE getting things DONE? Do you love the feeling of checking those boxesoff your to do list? Do you love to see your good work come to life in theworld? Do you love to implement? Does figuring out the “HOW” of how to getsomething done excite you? Do you thrive on getting things executed? Do youLOVE systems and processes for streamlining tasks?


Doyou get tremendous satisfaction from seeing people’s lives become betterbecause of work that YOU did? Do you LOVE a fast-paced, dynamic environment whereyou can get LOTS of things done at once? Do you get bored when there’s only ONEthing to do? DO you LIGHT up when you get to move a whole bunch of stuffforward to completion?
Areyou someone that is looking for a meaningful career and not just another job?An organization where you aren’t a number, but instead a valued teammate? Acareer that is as rewarding as it is challenging? If your head is currentlynodding yes to all of these then this may be the long term career opportunityyou have been searching for. 

ROLE


We are looking for a key member of our operations team, anoperations implementation team member. In this position, you will beresponsible for executing and implementing operations tasks in support of ourprograms, events and marketing. 
The operations team member is an implementation role thathandles the tasks surrounding the creation, delivery, maintenance, and supportof our operations, programs, and events. This team member must keep our missionfront and center while executing the day-to-day tasks that keep our systems andprocesses moving forward in a timely, orderly, and efficient manner. 

The operations team member will work with the OperationsTeam to standardize processes and procedures to ensure scalability.
This means executing within the daily operations,communicating bottle-necks and holes in processes so they can be repaired,communicating with all team members, an ensuring that there are clear pathwaysto results.


Responsibilities

AssistProject Managers with all work flow to keep things moving forward so nothinggets dropped.


Implementand execute on all operations tasks that need to get done to support ourdelivery of programs and events.


Creating,editing, proofreading documents.


Navigatingcalendars, call schedules, timelines, and project plans.


Following upon outstanding issues with vendors, suppliers, and event sites.


Assistingwith product, site, and logistical research.


Communicatingand answering questions for team members.


Updating andmaintaining SOPs and assisting in the creation and maintenance of our onlinelearning base.


Work hand inhand with the project managers daily, to ensure that nothing gets missed andremove any blocks so that things can keep moving forward.


Bring yourRESOURCEFUL and PASSIONATE can-do attitude to anything that needs to get donefor this organization!


An expert increating and maintaining systems and processes to improve efficiencies, fillholes and catch what got missed so it doesn’t happen again.


Able toadapt quickly and explore new frontiers, as well as being able to see newopportunities


Able toorganize and execute on multiple operations tasks simultaneously


Strongbackground in executing and getting things done that you’ve not done before, asyou will be faced with juggling many tasks and solving challenges every singleday


Upholdingthe commitments, we make


Bringing astandard of excellence. Having a “whatever it takes” approach. And being a teamplayer who loves to help other team members get stuff done!


Keep theProject Management tool moving smoothly and keep it organized.


Keep SOPsupdated and create new ones where SOPs don’t exist yet.


Stay currentand available in SLACK, our messaging app, during your working hours. 


RESULTS
Take stuff off of the plates of the owners and projectmanagers to keep them moving forward


If a project is stuck or tasks are not getting done, removethe log-jam and keep things moving forward


Be resourceful and bring your unique brilliance to helpRelationship Development have the impact we need to have.


Create that peace of mind in the team that we know that“you’ve got this”!


REQUIREMENTS

At least 2 years’ experience in operations andimplementation


Excellent skills in at least one of the majorproject management software platforms (we use Asana)


Technology maven (you do awesome with yourtech and easily pick up new tech)


You take 100% personal responsibility foryour life and your outcomes


ABSOLUTE Integrity


Do “whatever it takes” attitude


Perks:


Compensation: This full time position has a salary of $33,000 per year.


Remote: This is a remote position, which allows you to workfrom anywhere.

*This job is notall-inclusive and certain activities, duties, or responsibilities may berequired of the employee as needed.

Apply for this position

For the full role description and application, click here: https://forms.relationshipdevelopment.org/operations-team-member-role-app

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=1, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
Company Description

70+ employees. Talented people worldwide.
4 countries. An international reach.
1 mission. Becoming the ultimate open commerce platform for business and private customers.

payever started with a simple idea: We want to make buying and selling easier everyday. With a team of over 70 members around the world, we've built a unique CommerceOS with all the tools people need to start, run and grow their business. After 4 years of high growth and international expansion, we’re currently working on even more new apps to enhance the entire commerce experience, and it’s your chance to take part in innovation.

Join our team of digital natives with deep retail and tech expertise, supported by Europe's leading early stage investors High Tech-Gründerfonds and Microsoft Ventures.

Job Description

To cover one of the core positions in our Hamburg HQ, we're looking for an ambitious and analytical individual - a people person who is also detail-oriented, to join us our team as Azure Cloud Engineer.

In this role, your day will look something like this:

- Administer servers/services in Microsoft Azure;
- Responsible for planning, provisioning, tuning, configuring systems;
- Investigate failures, fix them and execute root-cause analysis; must take ownership of problems and communicate progress in a timely and effective manner;
- Determines how existing applications, legacy systems, databases, web interfaces, and/or hardware logic which may be currently operating on multiple platforms, work with internal teams to meet the new and emerging business requirements in the cloud;
- Interact with and effectively communicate with your DevOps colleagues and cross-functional teams to complete the assigned projects or support;
- Researches and evaluate emerging cloud technologies and proactively recommend areas where they can bring business value;
- Deploy and maintain a cloud network data center infrastructure and processes necessary;
- Configure (through automation) infrastructure and applications for high performance and highly available operation to meet business needs;
- Monitor and improve performance and stability;

Qualifications

You'll fit right in if you have the following skills:

Your profile:
- MS/BS in Information Technology/Systems, Computer Science, or engineering.
- 2+ years of experience in Microsoft Azure;
- 7+ years of Linux experience;
- Proven track record in architecting/supporting cloud infrastructure for highly available, highly scalable, multi-tier web-based systems;
- Experience in security cloud computing and PCI DSS compliance;
- Strong understanding of best practices for secure systems design;
- In-depth knowledge of the concepts of Infrastructure as Code, Automation, and Orchestration;
- Strong hands on experience with configuration management tools like Ansible or CloudFormation;
- Advanced level in scripting languages, Bash and/or Python or Ruby;
- Knowledge of Active Directory, git, GlusterFS, nginx and php-fpm;
- Knowledge of Linux KVM virtualization;
Experience in clustering and security audit;
- General understanding of Microservices, with preference of Docker;
- Networking experience in routing, firewalls and HA architecture;
- Great working knowledge of IP networking, VPN’s, DNS, load balancing and volume scaling;
- Configuration and maintenance of common applications and protocols;
- Experience with MySQL and NoSQL such as Elasticsearch preferred;
- Experience working with remote and distributed teams;
- Experience managing teams and building processes.

Who you are:

- You’re fluent in English, and a good communicator
- You’re a problem solver, and approach obstacles with a logical, pragmatic approach
- You have enthusiasm and ability to quickly learn new tools and technology
- You possess a collaborative, open-minded and helpful approach to teamwork
- You’re motivated and a self-starter, someone who’s always looking for ways to improve things
- You’re able to organise and work with multiple projects and different deadlines

Additional information

We’re now 4 years old, but we’re hungry like it’s Day One - we still have the same big dreams and are looking for your help to achieve them!

What we offer:

Our Team

Our people are our best feature. We help each other out, laugh, help, support, and discuss everyone’s point of view, in an agile way.

Flat structure and full transparency

Flat hierarchies and short decision paths mean that more of your ideas are heard, and turned into realities. Less bureaucracy, more results!

Focus on your growth

Clear career path from the start, access to learning material and a plan for your professional growth, so you’ll always know what to expect.

Competitive pay rates

We want our talent to be able to fully concentrate on their work. Which is why make sure you are paid well and on time.

Sound exciting? We think so too, and we can’t wait to hear from you!

items.content:
Devops Engineer (Deployment / Security / Data Management)

Posted Jun 20

Hazy
Headquarters: London, UK
https://angel.co/hazy/jobs/368133-devops-engineer-london-or-remote-in-europe
View all Hazy jobs →

Hazy is a low touch SAAS that helps people use data whilst treating it responsibly. We're looking for a generalist devops engineer to focus on deployment infrastructure, security and data management.

This is a mid-level to senior role for an experienced developer who is comfortable as both a solutions architect and a reliability engineer. Our ideal candidate is a "secops" geek, i.e.: passionate about both devops and security and the interplay between them.

We currently have a variety of services developed in Elixir, Go and Python/Cython deployed on Google Cloud Platform using Terraform and Kubernetes. We need to both move to a multi-cloud setup so that we're also deployed on AWS and Azure and package our service for on-premise deployment. Both of which raise some fun architectural and operational challenges.

We have a data pipeline backed by Apache Pulsar that processes ongoing streams of raw and anonymised data. Data is encrypted using keys managed in Hashicorp Vault. We've implemented scoped access control and network security / service isolation. This infrastructure and security design needs to be reviewed, verified, hardened and improved on an ongoing basis.

We also handle sensitive data sets and have long term challenges around data throughput, durability, visibility and optimised AI/ML evaluation.

We envisage that you're a generalist developer who enjoys focusing on devops and infrastructure automation. Your skills and experience naturally span across:

  • backend web development
  • unix system administration
  • containers and build systems
  • cloud deployment infrastructure
  • application and network security
  • service architecture

It's essential that you have experience running and maintaining production systems. You should also be strongly motivated by privacy and data ethics.

We're a remote-first team with headquarters in London. You can be based in London or work remotely. If you're remote, you ideally need to be based in Europe and you must be willing to travel to the UK to meet up face-to-face on a regular basis.

Apply for this position

Send me (James - CTO) an email on thruflo@hazy.com with (1) your CV and / or profile links and (2) a brief explanation of why you're interested in the role.

items.content:
DevOps Engineer

Posted Jun 19

Interpersonal Frequency
Headquarters: Seattle
https://ifsight.com/
View all Interpersonal Frequency jobs →

Interpersonal Frequency (I.F.) is seeking a full-time DevOps Engineer to add to our growing team.

About Us

At I.F., we're putting the government in the cloud. We design, build, maintain, and grow sites on our open source, highly available web stack for some of the largest cities, public libraries, and government agencies in the country. We also created a suite of proprietary analytics tools that survey 3.4 million Americans each day. We are looking for a DevOps engineer to help us scale our systems as we bring more cities and government agencies into the cloud. Our backend tech stack currently includes RHEL/CentOS, Docker, Node.js, PHP, Apache/Nginx, Solr/ElasticSearch, MariaDB/MySQL, GlusterFS, Redis/Memcache, HAProxy, Varnish, New Relic, and AWS (GovCloud, EC2, ELB, RDS, Aurora, ElastiCache, S3, CloudFormation, Redshift, EFS, etc.), DigitalOcean, and Rackspace.

I.F. is a profitable, 10 year-old company with team members in Seattle, Denver and the DC area.

We provide a remote work environment, so you don't need to move for this job. We encourage face to face collaboration in our regional offices and expect you to travel when required.

Working remotely means we can bring together some of the best minds in the country. Between video calls and Slack, the distance evaporates quickly, and ideas, projects and puns fly at the speed of light. Working remotely also allows us to find harmony in work / life balance.

I.F. has grown an impressive portfolio of library, city, county and federal government clients. We are looking for team players who can work closely with our top tier software developers and our clients.

Who you are

We're looking for a senior DevOps engineer with significant experience configuring, managing, automating, securing, monitoring and maintaining systems at scale.

  • You love to solve problems and can do so under pressure.
  • Scaling, reliability, automation, security, and performance are things you care about deeply.
  • You have a good mixture of planning, risk taking and a "get-it-done" attitude.
  • You value the open source community and want to give back to it.
  • You can clearly explain your ideas to both clients and other team members both verbally and in writing. Most of all, you're not a jerk: you like to have fun and work with a small team! You play well with others (not just engineers).
  • You bring both creativity and maturity to your work: you're a self-starter who can jump in quickly and can manage your own time effectively in a remote work environment.

What you'll do

You will help ensure the scalability, security, performance, and availability of our systems by applying your expertise in the evolution and daily operation of our LAMP/LEMP stack, implementing and automating infrastructure deployments and working with our engineering team to ensure the software that we build can scale.

Requirements

  • You must either be a US Citizen or already have a Green Card to apply
  • 3-5 years of experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud hosting
  • 3+ years of experience with MySQL (DevOps, not DBA)
  • Linux
  • Nginx and/or Apache
  • Varnish
  • PHP (DevOps tuning, not dev)
  • Docker
  • Shell scripting
  • Ansible / Chef / Puppet
  • Code repository versioning (Git)

Bonus Skills

  • Memcached/Redis
  • CentOS/Redhat Linux
  • HAProxy
  • MariaDB/MySQL Clustering
  • Elasticsearch and/or Apache Solr
  • Code repository hosting (e.g. Gitlab)
  • Drupal Optimization
  • Big Data (e.g. Hadoop, Redshift)
  • Authentication Integration (e.g. LDAP/AD/SAML)
  • Penetration testing
  • Load testing
  • GlusterFS
  • Performance testing (e.g. New Relic, Blackfire)
  • Jenkins

Why work with us?

  • Fun, cutting edge remote work environment – ever changing, always a chat away from team members
  • Your work directly impacts the lives of millions of Americans every day
  • Regence BlueShield Healthcare, and Guardian Dental/Vision/Life/Disability plans
  • Unlimited vacation, and a flexible schedule
  • Work from home, or from one of our main offices. If you work from home, be prepared to travel once a quarter for face-to-face with the team
If you are interested, please send your cover letter and resume to devopsjobs@ifsight.com.

Apply for this position

Send cover letter and resume to devopsjobs@ifsight.com

items.content:
Interpersonal Frequency (I.F.) is seeking a full-time DevOps Engineer to add to our growing team.

About Us

At I.F., we're putting the government in the cloud. We design, build, maintain, and grow sites on our open source, highly available web stack for some of the largest cities, public libraries, and government agencies in the country. We also created a suite of proprietary analytics tools that survey 3.4 million Americans each day. We are looking for a DevOps engineer to help us scale our systems as we bring more cities and government agencies into the cloud. Our backend tech stack currently includes RHEL/CentOS, Docker, Node.js, PHP, Apache/Nginx, Solr/ElasticSearch, MariaDB/MySQL, GlusterFS, Redis/Memcache, HAProxy, Varnish, New Relic, and AWS (GovCloud, EC2, ELB, RDS, Aurora, ElastiCache, S3, CloudFormation, Redshift, EFS, etc.), DigitalOcean, and Rackspace.

I.F. is a profitable, 10 year-old company with team members in Seattle, Denver and the DC area.

We provide a remote work environment, so you don't need to move for this job. We encourage face to face collaboration in our regional offices and expect you to travel when required.

Working remotely means we can bring together some of the best minds in the country. Between video calls and Slack, the distance evaporates quickly, and ideas, projects and puns fly at the speed of light. Working remotely also allows us to find harmony in work / life balance.

I.F. has grown an impressive portfolio of library, city, county and federal government clients. We are looking for team players who can work closely with our top tier software developers and our clients.

Who you are

We're looking for a senior DevOps engineer with significant experience configuring, managing, automating, securing, monitoring and maintaining systems at scale.

  • You love to solve problems and can do so under pressure.
  • Scaling, reliability, automation, security, and performance are things you care about deeply.
  • You have a good mixture of planning, risk taking and a "get-it-done" attitude.
  • You value the open source community and want to give back to it.
  • You can clearly explain your ideas to both clients and other team members both verbally and in writing. Most of all, you're not a jerk: you like to have fun and work with a small team! You play well with others (not just engineers).
  • You bring both creativity and maturity to your work: you're a self-starter who can jump inquickly and can manage your own time effectively in a remote work environment.

What you'll do

You will help ensure the scalability, security, performance, and availability of our systems by applying your expertise in the evolution and daily operation of our LAMP/LEMP stack,implementing and automating infrastructure deployments and working with our engineering team to ensure the software that we build can scale.

Requirements

  • You must either be a US Citizen or already have a Green Card to apply
  • 3-5 years of experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud hosting
  • 3+ years of experience with MySQL (DevOps, not DBA)
  • Linux
  • Nginx and/or Apache
  • Varnish
  • PHP (DevOps tuning, not dev)
  • Docker
  • Shell scripting
  • Ansible / Chef / Puppet
  • Code repository versioning (Git)

Bonus Skills

  • Memcached/Redis
  • CentOS/Redhat Linux
  • HAProxy
  • MariaDB/MySQL Clustering
  • Elasticsearch and/or Apache Solr
  • Code repository hosting (e.g. Gitlab)
  • Drupal Optimization
  • Big Data (e.g. Hadoop, Redshift)
  • Authentication Integration (e.g. LDAP/AD/SAML)
  • Penetration testing
  • Load testing
  • GlusterFS
  • Performance testing (e.g. New Relic, Blackfire)
  • Jenkins

Why work with us?

  • Fun, cutting edge remote work environment – ever changing, always a chat away from team members
  • Your work directly impacts the lives of millions of Americans every day
  • Regence BlueShield Healthcare, and Guardian Dental/Vision/Life/Disability plans
  • Unlimited vacation, and a flexible schedule
  • Work from home, or from one of our main offices. If you work from home, be prepared to travelonce a quarter for face-to-face with the team

If you are interested, please send your cover letter and resume to devopsjobs@ifsight.com.

items.title: Executive Vice President of Engineering & Operations at Crossover
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Lead, Manager
Industry: Computer Software, Enterprise Software, Software Consulting
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Private

Technologies

javac++.netc#

Job description

This position is with ESW Capital or one of its affiliated companies.

The EVP of Engineering & Operations will serve as a key member of the global executive team.  As part of the leadership team, you will be expected to not only run a world-class engineering organization using our revolutionary and radically differentiated processes and which runs into thousands of individual contributors - you will also be expected to run operations across a variety of disciplines including SaaSOps, IT Ops, Support and Finance.  

You will be expected to be able to hire, coach and manage 5-15 SVPs who will run these global groups in our factory-like process with quantifiable business impact, You will be expected to be an expert at aggressive goal setting and weekly productivity improvements. The expectation to drive significant levels of value and productivity from your organization is much higher than in most companies. You must continuously improve the quality of your teams using our global talent sourcing. You will leverage your personal technical depth as a former developer and architect in order to set a personal standard for excellence.

Another critical element of this position is your ability to work closely with our F500 customer executives as well as key executives within ESW Capital.  The expectation is that you are a seasoned executive with great English communication skills that can effectively manage executive relationships.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES 

Continuous process improvements across multiple operations disciplines - including engineering, SaaSOps, IT Ops, Support and Finance

Hire, coach and manage 5-15 SVP-level executives owning a wide variety of critical business functions

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science is absolutely mandatory (MS or PhD preferred).

20+ years of engineering experience leading multiple teams across multiple products and technologies — this is a global leadership role for a seasoned executive, not a first-time executive role for a great software development manager.

Experience in effectively running an engineering and operations organization, which runs into the thousands. Minimum 5 years of hands-on, development-intensive contributor role.

Recent experience with DevOps and Cloud architecture. We live in the Cloud.

Experience with high-end enterprise systems deployed in environments of F500 corporation complexity.

Apply now

Benefits

  • Work from anywhere
  • Choose your own hours
  • Flat organization
  • Work with talented people all over the world
  • Committed to diversity
  • Competitive compensation

Job description

This position is with ESW Capital or one of its affiliated companies.

Working 100% remotely, with team members in every time zone, has its challenges: driving significant levels of value and productivity within teams of professionals from all over the world is one of them.

Our team members rise to that challenge by setting the bar for excellence high, and pushing for the next level of productivity whenever possible.

As Senior Vice President of Engineering & Operations, you must continuously improve the quality of your teams, while leveraging your personal technical depth as a former developer and architect in order to set a personal standard for excellence.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

Continuous process improvements across multiple operations disciplines - including Software Engineering, SaaSOps, IT Ops, Support and Finance.

Hire, coach and manage 5-15 VP-level executives owning a wide variety of critical business functions, but primarily focus on Software Engineering.

CANDIDATE REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science is absolutely mandatory (MS or PhD preferred).

20+ years of engineering experience leading multiple teams across multiple products and technologies — this is a global leadership role for a seasoned executive, not a first executive role for a great software development manager.

Experience running a 250+ person Software Engineering and operations organization effectively.

Spent at least 5 years in a software development role.

Be great at doing deep-dives into problem-solving with your teams and also to leverage your past technical expertise in Software Development, Quality Assurance, Cloud Infrastructure, and automated deployments using CI/CD tools.

Recent experience with DevOps and Cloud architecture. We live in the Cloud.

Experience with high-end enterprise systems deployed in environments of F500 corporation complexity.

Apply now

  • Work from anywhere
  • Choose your own hours
  • Flat organization
  • Work with talented people all over the world
  • Committed to diversity
  • Competitive compensation

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: System Administrator
Industry: Data & Analytics, Search, Software Development / Engineering
Company size: 501-1k people
Company type: VC Funded

Technologies

elasticsearchlinuxruby-on-railspythonpuppet

Job description

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world's data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what's possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. We unite Elasticians across 30+ countries (and counting!), 18 timezones and 30 different languages into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

Thanks to our ongoing expansion we have the opportunity to grow the Swiftype Site Reliability team at Elastic. We're a part of the engineering team with a focus on providing a reliable service to Swiftype SaaS customers and supporting the team in development, testing, and release efforts of Swiftype products. We’re looking for people who are just as passionate about solving issues with distributed systems as they are about automating, coding and collaborating to solve problems. Does this sound like you?

What You Will Do:

  • Work with the Swiftype engineering team daily to ensure high quality and reliability of the systems we deploy into production.
  • Increase instrumentation and automation in all aspects of day to day operations for Swiftype.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve any issues occurring in production ensuring constant improvement of the systems as a result.
  • Design and implement new systems to improve reliability and resilience of the systems in production.
  • Participate in SRE team's on-call rotation.

What You Bring Along:

  • 5+ years overall systems engineering experience.
  • 4+ years of experience with Linux systems administration.
  • 3+ years of hands on operational experience in a high-volume or critical production web service environments.
  • Software development experience (any platform/language/etc).
  • Experience deploying and operating large scale SaaS applications in production.
  • Good knowledge and understanding of server hardware (RAID levels, computer architecture, etc).
  • Good knowledge and understanding of Unix systems, solid Linux/UNIX systems administrator experience.
  • Deep understanding of the TCP/IP networking stack (IP addressing, routing, HTTP(S), etc).
  • Familiarity with systems and configuration management tools (Chef , Puppet, Terraform, Capistrano, etc).
  • Extensive experience with any enterprise monitoring systems like Nagios, Graphite, StatsD.
  • Experience deploying and operating MySQL in production.

Additional Information:

We're looking to hire team members invested in realizing the goal of making real-time data exploration easy and available to anyone. As a distributed company, we believe that diversity drives our vibe! Whether you're looking to launch a new career or grow an existing one, Elastic is the type of company where you can balance great work with great life.

  • Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary
  • Stock options
  • Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid in full parental leave (moms & dads)
  • Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off
  • Your age is only a number. It doesn't matter if you're just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.

Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

Apply now

About Elastic

Elastic builds software to make data usable in real time and at scale for search, logging, security, and analytics use cases. Founded in 2012, the company develops the open source Elastic Stack (Elasticsearch, Kibana, Beats, and Logstash), X-Pack (commercial features), and Elastic Cloud (a SaaS offering). To date, there have been more than 100 million cumulative downloads. The Elastic community is 100,000 members strong. Thousands of organizations including Cisco, eBay, Goldman Sachs, NASA, Microsoft, Mayo Clinic, The New York Times, Wikipedia, and Verizon use Elastic to power mission-critical systems. Backed by Benchmark Capital, Index Ventures, and NEA with more than $100 million in funding, Elastic has a distributed workforce with more than 600 employees in 30 countries. Learn more at elastic.co

Benefits

  • 401k Matching Up to 6 % in US and Pensions in some other countries
  • Health Care Insurance
  • Vacation Time Determined By Location
  • Lunch and Breakfast in Most Offices
  • 100% Remote work possible

items.content:
About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Role: DevOps
Industry: Digital Health
Company size: 51-200 people

Technologies

amazon-web-servicesjenkinspuppetvagrantamazon-cloudformationsysadmin

Job description

SemanticBits is seeking a DevOps Engineer to support the automation and deployment needs of a range of projects. You will work hand-in-hand with development teams to implement automation solutions using technologies like Amazon Web Services (AWS), CloudFormation, Ansible, Terraform, Elastic Compute Cloud, and Jenkins to automatically build, test, integrate, and deploy applications in the healthcare and life sciences domains. You will leverage the full power of the cloud to configure highly resilient and scalable applications that can handle hundreds of thousands of users. This is a remote position.

SemanticBits is a leading company specializing in the design and development of digital health services, and the work we do is just as unique as the culture we’ve created. We develop cutting-edge solutions to complex problems for commercial, academic, and government organizations. The systems we develop are used in finding cures for deadly diseases, improving the quality of healthcare delivered to millions of people, and revolutionizing the healthcare industry on a nationwide scale. There is a meaningful connection between our work and the real people who benefit from it; and, as such, we create an environment in which new ideas and innovative strategies are encouraged. We are an established company with the mindset of a startup and we feel confident that we offer an employment experience unlike any other and that we set our employees up for professional success every day.

REQUIREMENTS

We are looking for a DevOps Engineer who is well versed in the following key technologies:

  • Solid hands-on working experience with configuring and maintaining resources on AWS
  • Experience with the majority of EC2, ELB, CloudFormation, S3, Glacier, CodeDeploy, SNS, SQS, RDS, IAM
  • Hands-on understanding of virtualization and experience with Docker
  • Deep, hands-on experience with Linux and administration
  • Expertise with production deployments, and CI/CD tools such as Jenkins
  • Experience automating cloud infrastructure, such as with CloudFormation
  • Expertise with cloud security, such as managing users, roles, and privileges through IAM
  • Experience managing Atlassian tooling such as Jira and Confluence preferred
  • Experience deploying and managing a wide range of components that support web applications, such a nginx, Apache http, git, scripting (bash, Perl, Python, etc.), databases (MongoDB, PostgreSQL, etc.)
Apply now

About SemanticBits

SemanticBits designs and develops software for the health and life sciences industry. We have domain expertise in biomedicine and understand the challenges that medical professionals face when managing and sharing data. And, we have the technical skills to create sophisticated semantic-based systems that are easy to use. Our company is run by software engineers, and we know how to build software that works.  Software developed by SemanticBits helps in conducting clinical trials across the country that are helping save lives every day.  Our software is being used to help decide treatments using genomic data.  Our software is making a difference.  We are agile, driven, and foster creativity.  We have long-term projects and low employee turnover rate. SemanticBits hires people interested in opportunities that go beyond mere job descriptions. Our employees work in a dynamic environment because we respect the talents of every member of our team and encourage creative solutions. We believe in what we are doing ---- helping in the fight to cure diseases --- and we hire people who are passionate about taking this challenge head on.

SemanticBits is a company that continues to grow not only in its size, but even more so in its professional reputation and prestige. We take pride in our close-knit team of highly talented individuals who work with cutting-edge technologies to find new solutions that address complicated problems in the health and life sciences domain. Our company offers an open work environment that encourages thinking aloud and communicating freely. At SemanticBits, there is no big corporate hierarchy; we, as a team, work together to achieve our goals. We foster a warm and friendly environment with regular happy hours, free coffee and snacks, and monthly brown-bag sessions.

BENEFITS

  • Generous base salary
  • Three weeks of PTO
  • Excellent health benefits program (Medical, dental and vision)
  • Education and conference reimbursement
  • 401k retirement plan. We contribute 3% of base salary irrespective of employee's contribution
  • 100% paid short-term and long-term disability
  • 100% paid life insurance
  • FSA
  • Casual working environment
  • Flexible office hours
  • New laptop (Mac or PC - your choice)

SemanticBits, LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and embraces workplace diversity.

Benefits

  • Medical, dental, vision, life, disability
  • Matched 401K plan
  • Generous vacation allowances, floating holidays, and sick leave
  • Continued Education Reimbursement
  • Free coffee and snacks

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead, Manager
Role: DevOps, System Administrator
Industry: Software Development, Web Design
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Technologies

elk-stackjenkinsprometheusredhatkubernetessysadmin

Job description

Our engineers have experience in a consultative environment, excellent communication skills and a desire to work with talented teams building innovative products. We work closely with our clients, sharing our experience and processes to help them define and create their products.

We are looking for Operations Engineers with experience using Infrastructure as Code and Configuration Management tools, deploying applications to cloud services such as AWS and Azure. Experience developing backend applications is not required but definitely a plus.

Job Requirements:

  • Experience with Infrastructure as Code and Configuration Management tools.
  • Proficient in Ruby and at least one other programming language.
  • Knowledge of the ELK stack.
  • Experience with Prometheus/Grafana for metrics aggregation/visualization.
  • Configuration of CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins.
  • Experience using/maintaining RedHat/RHEL 7 servers.
  • Experience using Kubernetes.
  • Experience with automation tools/platforms.
  • Experience with alerting and monitoring tools.
  • Experience working in a highly distributed company
  • Being open minded and always learning.

Duties & Responsibilities:

  • Design, creation and provisioning of infrastructure.
  • Deploy and maintain applications.
  • Collaborate with other engineers to implement operational solutions while adhering to and defining organizational best practices.
Apply now

About Citrusbyte

Citrusbyte is a software consultancy focused on using modern tools to solve complex problems for global businesses. We are a pioneer in remote workplaces with a diverse team of communicative, experts spread across 20+ countries.

We strongly advocate minimalism and this is represented in the tools we choose to work with. Every team gets to decide on their own stack depending on the requirements of the project.

Our main offices are in Los Angeles and New York, but we work remotely with people from all around the world.

Benefits

  • Open Vacation Policy
  • Hardware
  • Health, Vision, Dental Benefits
  • Fitness Reimbursement Program
  • Flexible Work Hours
  • Paternity & Maternity Leave
  • Education Allowance
  • Conference Assistance
  • Annual Company Retreat
